Name: Internal Wet Areas (Bathrooms & Laundries waterproofing
Details
Area Barricaded off to allow no access to internal wet areas with signs posted/visible to include date of application, 'no access waterproofing work in progress
attach relevant photos
Membrame system & methodology checked off against Landmark waterproofing details as per the Australian standard and MSDS
substrate clean, structurally sound & ready...
ensure no high points..
Holdpoint- do not proceed if above...
Apply PVC primer to all PVC drains and pipes
attach relevant photos
Primer substrate with Trem proof 200EC as per data sheet and application guidelines
attach relevant photos
Install alluminium waterstops to door entries and showers as per landmarks FFL
attach relevant photos
seal all joints, gaps, cracks... with Tremflex 50 sealant- apply selected sealant as per datasheet & application guidelines
attach relevant photos
Apply 1st coat of Vulkem NEM plus on floors at the recommended thickness as per datasheet & application guidelines
attach relevant photos
Apply 2nd coat of Vulkem NEM plus on floors at the recommended thickness as per datasheet & application guidelines
attach relevant photos
Waterproof walls of showers & vanity up to 1.8m ceiling at the recommended thickness as per datasheet & application guidelines
Allow membrane to dry
flood test for a minimum of 24 hours
attach relevant photos
Carry out dry film thickness using positector coating thickness inspection instruction- review result against datasheet & application guidelines
Final sign off- all general waterproofing work completed as per the above ITP
Holdpoint- do not proceed if above...
